intro: Downingia concolor var. brevior, commonly known as the slender Downingia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
